Take a minute and think about what you might be overwhelmed with at the current moment. Sometimes we donâ€™t even notice this feeling, almost like it has integrated itself into our lives. Ultimately if this feeling goes unnoticed, it can make our lives just that much more unhappy.

If you decide that you are feeling overwhelmed, the fastest way to overcome that feeling is to make a battleplan. It might not be easy, but I guarantee that a good plan will help. Knowing what you will do to minimize or illiminate the outcome helps both your state of mind in the current moment and youâ€™ll make a more informed decision when that dreaded moment eventually comes.

Take the flipside of overwhelm. Instead of something that you wish wouldnâ€™t happen, how about something that you wish will happen. Is there something that youâ€™ve always wanted to do? Mabye a skill youâ€™ve always wanted to learn. Whatever you want to do, the feeling of overwhelm can control you here as well. It can paralyze you, stop you from taking even the tiny steps towards the future you want.

Iâ€™m not saying Iâ€™m an expert, or even good at managing the overwhelm. Itâ€™s just that I have a lot of experience with it. Itâ€™s one of those things that build while you donâ€™t manage it. Do yourself a favor and ask yourself where you see it appearing or growing and make that battle plan.

Have a better day :)
